meanings.definition: A member of a choir who sings or leads the singing of a group of singers.
meanings.sent1: The young choristers practiced their songs for the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent2: The church choir consisted of talented choristers.
meanings.sent3: The choristers giggled as they tried to hit the high notes during practice.
meanings.sent4: The harmonious voices of the choristers filled the hall like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated choristers always arrived early to warm up their vocal cords.

meanings.definition: A group of singers, especially children, who sing in a choir.
meanings.sent1: The school choir was made up of enthusiastic choristers.
meanings.sent2: The sweet voices of the choristers echoed through the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The little choristers wore matching robes and looked adorable on stage.
meanings.sent4: The unity among the choristers was as strong as the notes they sang.
meanings.sent5: The proud parents applauded as the choristers finished their performance.
